conclusion: Determine how shadows will change if the light source moves forward above the objects.
Position of the light source is currently at an angle relative to the objects, casting shadows directly below them.
If the light source moves forward, it will be more directly above the objects.
As the light source moves forward, the shadows will move closer to the objects themselves.
The size of the shadows will decrease because the light rays will be more concentrated and less spread out when they hit the ground.
The shape of the shadows may change slightly, becoming more circular or less elongated.
Shadow A will move closer to the object and become smaller.
Shadow B will move closer to the object and become smaller.
Shadow C will move closer to the object and become smaller.
Shadow D will move closer to the object and become smaller.
Final Answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will all move closer to the objects and become smaller.
